message.content: This question requires an understanding of the seasons and their duration. Spring occurs once every year, so in a decade (which is ten years), spring would occur ten times. Option (A) is incorrect because spring occurs once a year, not three times. Option (B) is incorrect because there are only four seasons in a year, so twelve times would imply that each season occurs three times, which is not the case. Option (D) is incorrect because spring occurs once a year, not twice.

Option (A) is incorrect because spring occurs once a year, not three times. Option (B) is incorrect because there are only four seasons in a year - spring, summer, autumn, and winter. Option (D) is incorrect because spring does not occur twice in a decade; it occurs once every year. So, the correct answer is option (C) - ten times.
